radiographic_examinations.findings: Fecal material throughout the colon, distention of the small bowel, gaseous distention of the stomach, and no airâ€“fluid levels.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On follow-up, abdominal radiographs showed resolution of gastric and small-bowel dilatation after disimpaction.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Massive dilatation of the stomach and distal small bowel, abundant stool without any transition point, minimal ascites.
Bone age of 15 years 6 months, indicating delayed skeletal maturation.
Normal pituitary gland, mildly prominent ventricles and sulci suggesting loss of cerebral volume.
